Description: -One (1) person was reported missing -Based on Coast Guard Station Southern Palawan report, the victim went fishing venture onboard his motorbanca 'AL- KHALAM' on the waters on the vicinity of Barangay Marangas at about 2:00AM of 12 September 2024 but failed to return at the expected time.
Actions Taken: -Search and rescue operation was conducted but was stopped due to unfavorable weather condition. -Information dissemination was conducted to all fisher folk near the area to be on lookout for the missing fisherman. -Search and rescue operation to be continued if weather condition permits.
Remarks: Previously reported missing on 12 September 2024 but was found alive on 13 September 2024.

Description: At around 02:31 PM, a tornado incident happened at Sito Marabahay Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. A total of five (5) houses were struck and two (2) of the houses' walls and roofs were blown off. Additionally, a total of 33 families / 139 persons were affected. Furthermore, a total of 30 families had partially damaged houses and three (3) families had totally damaged houses recorded as per report from Brgy. Secretary of Rio Tuba.
Actions Taken: ERT responded on the affected area. On-going repair as of September 20, 2024.

Description: 6 missing individuals, accordingly, the said individuals aboard a pump boat tried to save a boat being carried away by water but due to strong winds, they were not able to return to the island The group (Hji Apeh Julalie et al) were found alive in the vicinity of Tawi-tawi on 19 September 2024. On 21 September 2024, they were ferried back home aboard BRP Malapascua.
Remarks: reflected in DILG MDM

Description: 1 fisherman went missing when he chased his boat drifting away on September 16, 2024 and reported missing on September 17, 2024. UPDATE: About 5:30 PM of September 18, 2024, a cadaver was reported through to the Balabac MPS found at the mangrove area of Sitio Panaa, Barangay Catagupan, Balabac, Palawan by a fisherman at about 4:00 PM of September 18, 2024. The investigation conducted disclosed that the found cadaver was positively identified by the wife of the victim through the clothes he wore when he disappeared. Further, the family of the victim believed that the victim drowned while recovering his boat. The family decided to bury the cadaver immediately due to their religious tradition (Islam).
Remarks: per DILG MDM

Description: On 13 September 2024, around 01:30 PM flash floods were experienced at Malabang and Balabagan due to incessant rains brought about by the Southwest Monsoon affecting Mindanao. In addition, several uprooted trees have been reported in several municipalities in the province
Actions Taken: - Local DRRM Officers and other stakeholders in the area responded to the incidents, conducted rescue operations to affected families and stranded commuters. - Conducted Clearing operation at Narciso Ramos National High Way in Malabang Lanao del Sur - Conducted Clearing operation due to uprooted tree at Baragay Paigoay, Marogong Lanao del Sur. - Conducted clearing operation for the fallen trees at Ibn Kaldon Integrated School, Pagalamatan, Binidayan, Lanao del Sur.

Description: Resulted in 4 dead and 3 injured persons.
Remarks: Still for verification and validation.

Description: On 13 September 2024, around 01:30 PM flash floods were experienced at Malabang and Balabagan due to incessant rains brought about by the Southwest Monsoon affecting Mindanao. In addition, several uprooted trees have been reported in several municipalities in the province.
Actions Taken: - Local DRRM Officers and other stakeholders in the area responded to the incidents, conducted rescue operations to affected families and stranded commuters. - Conducted clearing operations at Narciso Ramos National High Way in Malabang Lanao del Sur. - Conducted clearing operations due to uprooted tree at Baragay Paigoay, Marogong Lanao del Sur. - Conducted clearing operations for the fallen trees at Ibn Kaldon Integrated School, Pagalamatan, Binidayan, Lanao del Sur.

Description: On 13 September 2024, flooding incident were reported at Sitio Kabugkabug and Dela Fuente, Brgy. Rempes and Sitio Magutay, Brgy. Kabakaba, Upi due to moderate to heavy rainfall experienced in the area.
Actions Taken: - On 12 September 2024, conducted Pre disaster risk assessment. - Activated the Upi Emergency Operation Center - Continuous issuance and updating of weather forecast on social media and through text blast. - Continuous monitoring of water level along Matuber River, Nuro Creek, and Tubuan River. - Conducted clearing operations in Brgy Rempes, Darugao, Kibleg, and Nangi, Upi.

Description: On 13 September 2024, fallen trees were reported in Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao del Norte, which resulted in 3 injured persons.
Actions Taken: Continuous monitoring to the 35 BDRRMCs.
Remarks: Said incidents happened in Barangay Awang and Barangay Capiton. Still subject for validation.

Description: On 15 September 2024. 12:00 PM, MDRRMO reported flooding in Brgy Gang and Limbo due to overflow of water in Nuling Creek due to heavy rainfall in the area.
Actions Taken: Continuous monitoring to the BDRRMCs.

Description: On 16 September 2024. 11:00 PM, MDRRMO reported flooding in most of the AOR of Talitay, they experienced heavy rainfall resulting to spread of additional volume of water.
Actions Taken: -Convening BDRRMC and MDRRMC -Lobbying to higher office for possible interventions and supports

Description: On 14 September 2024, around 12:10AM MDRRMO reported that Sitio Panusolen and Sitio Balas of Barangay Muti, Guindulungan are already flooded due to incessant rain experienced.
Actions Taken: - Monitoring and constant coordination, warning, sounding of sirens. - Directive to implement pre-emptive action. - Implementation of pre- emptive action. - Deployment of Rescue Team, assessment of the situation, meetings and instructions, sustain preparedness and intact of responders. - Deployment of responders. - Traffic arrangements with PNP. - Initial assessments, enlistment of affected families, preparations for relief operations

Description: On 14 September 2024, around 01:10 AM MDRRMO reported that Brgy TambunanI, Brgy Timbaluan, and Brgy South Binangga, Talayan, MDS are flooded due to incessant rainfall.
Actions Taken: - Continuous assessment and validating the situation. - Municipal Emergency Operation Center (EOC) is activated. - BFP, AFP, PNP, MDRRMO RESCUE TEAM, BPATS and Volunteers are also in the area to monitor and rescue the affected families. - MMO and ME conducted validation and assessment in the area. - DPWH 12 assessed and inspect the National Road and Bridges. - Conducted inventory of response resource. - Closely monitored of current situation. - Disseminated warning information to the barangay officials. - Continuous coordination to the Barangay Officials. - Immediate distribution of drinking water and foods. - Preparation for another distribution of Food Packs.

Description: On 13 September 2024, due to the effects of Southwest Monsoon affecting Mindanao, the municipality of Paglat experienced Heavy Rainfall which resulted to flooding of the low- lying areas in the municipality.
Actions Taken: Continuous assessment and validating the situation.

Description: -On 13 September 2024, due to the effects of the Southwest Monsoon affecting Mindanao, the municipality of Mamasapano experienced Heavy Rainfall which resulted in flooding of the low- lying areas in the municipality. -As of 14 September 2024, six (6) barangays in Mamasapano were flooded.
Actions Taken: -Monitoring for possible pre-emptive or force evacuation of the residents. -Alerted the Barangay DRRM Council. -Send warnings and advisories. -Released situation report. -Activated Blue Alert Status. -Standby emergency responders from BLGU, 33rd IB, 6th IB, MPS Mamasapano, and BFP Mamasapano.

Description: On 15 September 2024, MDRRMO reported flooding in ten (10) barangays of Rajah Buayan.
Actions Taken: -Conducted RDANA to flood affected areas. -Conducted continuous monitoring to flood affected areas.

Description: On 15 September 2024, MDRRMO reported heavy rainfall that caused swelling of rivers and creeks that led to flooding in residential and agricultural areas in the municipality of Datu Abdullah Sangki. Numbers of affected families and hectares of affected agricultural land is still subject for validation.
Actions Taken: -MDRRMO conducted assessment to affected areas. -MAFAR MMO will conduct an assessment and validation to affected agricultural areas.

Description: On 14 September 2024, nine (9) barangays in Sultan sa Barongis were flooded.
Actions Taken: -Conducted RDANA to affected areas thru BDRRMO and Brgy Officials. -Activated Emergency Operations Center to Red Alert Status and imposed pre emptive evacuation in affected areas.

Description: On 14 September 2024, six (6) barangays in Datu Saudi Ampatuan were flooded.
